aspace_helpers.title: construct MARC record from C0140 ASpace component
import updates to restriction notes, including end dates

comments.body: `client.get('users/5', Connection: 'keep-alive').parsed` returns a response; now trying with a big request

> `client.get('users/5', Connection: 'keep-alive').parsed` returns a response; now trying with a big request

This times out just the same
The correct parameter is   `containers = @client.get("#{resource}/top_containers", { timeout: 1000 }).parsed` (1000 may be overkill, but it's now returning containers)

aspace_helpers.title: aspace2alma: import item records to Alma

comments.body:
The endpoint for retrieving all instances associated with a collection times out even with moderately-sized collections:

https://archivesspace.github.io/archivesspace/api/#get-top-containers-linked-to-a-published-resource-and-published-archival-ojbects-contained-within.
 
Example: /repositories/3/resources/1511/top_containers

If we can't get the endpoint to work, we'll need to go through a cascade of API calls (resource --> resolve ao's --> resolve instances), which is going to slow down the process dramatically. It currently takes about half an hour without instances. I've contacted Lyrasis and asked whether anything can be done on my side or theirs to optimize calls to this endpoint.
Timeout issue is resolved (https://github.com/pulibrary/aspace_helpers/issues/245) by adding a `timeout` parameter to the get request.

bibdata.title: Remove calling method through scope for full scsb dump type
CDL Record Does Not Show "View Digital Content" Link

comments.body:
We asked Liza in Reserve & Resource Sharing if it's possible not to place CDL items in temporary locations.
Liza instructed staff in Reserves that CDL items that go on 'Reserve' not to be in a temporary location. 
We should keep this issue open until we make sure that CDL records are not placed in temporary locations and that the ones in temporary locations have been reassigned to a permanent location.

orangelight.title: Deprecate Integration with Borrow Direct API for "Resource Sharing" requests

comments.body:
Looking at the codebase I see there are already a few files related to borrow direct that don't seem to be used

https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/main/app/models/concerns/requests/bd_utils.rb
https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/main/app/models/requests/borrow_direct_lookup.rb

This is the file where the current behavior that tries a BD request, followed by an ILLiad request is present. 

https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/ddb644404b5471b5c7d263efc9f62be017ef0b1e/app/models/requests/submissions/borrow_direct.rb

Our new state when ReShare is launched will be to just execute this method https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/ddb644404b5471b5c7d263efc9f62be017ef0b1e/app/models/requests/submissions/borrow_direct.rb#L72 for every item. At some point ReShare may have an API where we can return to the former behavior but as I understand thing will be available post-launch.

Coverage remained the same at 94.524% when pulling **b398cb02e26b0b906229aea578a50f5c272784ed on 3003-resource-sharing-availability** into **70f77abb34bfe0401d7b04ba375daca8b8c35df3 on main**.

orangelight.title: Link purpose in context - home page and record page
Exception: Requests::Submission: Item does not have a delivery mode

comments.body: https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/54399/faults/87416546
@christinach Can we close this ticket then? Or do we need to update our error handling?

@kevinreiss the error handling was added to track items that have no delivery mode. I opened it in case we want to track down the items and why they don't have a delivery mode. Do we need to create a report for circulation? Or was there another reason for raising this exception.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/51709119/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/51709119)

Coverage increased (+0.005%) to 94.515% when pulling **e94a1671570de5648f4dded9fef570ab02ac1256 on non_db_admins** into **a9ceefcafad845b7d8f3b6a4ce5afb339d0260dd on flipflop_with_admins**.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/51709960/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/51709960)

Coverage decreased (-0.009%) to 94.515% when pulling **7c85cfcd420418768450bd602e06887c0af8e944 on flipflop_with_admins** into **70f77abb34bfe0401d7b04ba375daca8b8c35df3 on main**.

I think what that is showing *is* the Rails ActiveRecord - you can turn on different strategies, and right now the only two active strategies are active_record and default. If we added another strategy - cookies, sequel, redis, etc., those columns would be added to the dashboard, in the order listed in the `config/features.rb` file

princeton_ansible.title: increased file upload size for pdc_describe

comments.body:
The  http://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_core_module.html#client_max_body_size docs suggest that this is not the source of the issue, since set to `0` the load-balancer should not check the size of uploaded files.

Two possible fixes to investigate:
- look at the block size in the location stanza
- check the browser tab for the error code we're seeing here
Looked at in the Ansible Open House - agreed to break out the inventory to match group_vars (so, for example, put the zookeeper boxes in a separate file).
